intro: Psychotria helferiana var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest undergrowth. It produces small, round berries that are yellow when mature, containing seeds that are dispersed by animals. This variant is distinguished by its narrower leaf morphology compared to other varieties within the Psychotria genus.
